conbody.p: You have completed a functional single-humbucker guitar circuit with volume and tone controls. Your guitar now converts string vibrations into electrical signals that flow through properly grounded components to your amplifier.

section.title: Maintaining Your Wiring
section.p: Well-executed guitar wiring requires minimal maintenance. Check solder joints periodically if your guitar experiences heavy use or impacts. Clean potentiometer contacts with contact cleaner if controls become scratchy. Properly wired circuits can last the lifetime of the instrument.

section.title: Next Steps
section.p: Your completed single-humbucker circuit can serve as a foundation for future enhancements. Common next steps include adding coil-splitting switches, installing additional pickups, or experimenting with different capacitor values for varied tone responses.
